messages.content: You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using PHP and the Laravel framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. In `routes/web.php`, I found that `PostController::class, 'show'` is imported to process HTTP requests to the path `/posts/{post}`. I'll provide you with the contents of file `routes/web.php`, you have the option to execute additional Unix commands to gather more information if necessary, but you must not run the source code of the project, and your task is to find files that contain the implementation of `PostController::class, 'show'`. You must focus on the implementation itself and ignore unit tests or functional tests. You need to output a list of paths to the files that contain the handler implementations, ensuring that each path is relative to the project's directory. You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

{'stdout': 'app/Http/Controllers/Admin/PostController.php:14:class PostController extends Controller
app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/PostController.php:13:class PostController extends Controller
app/Http/Controllers/PostController.php:9:class PostController extends Controller
', 'stderr': ''}

function.name: run_command
function.description: Run a Unix command and get outputs in the project directory. You must not run any source code of the project.

message.content:
Paths containing the handler implementations for PostController::class, 'show':

- app/Http/Controllers/PostController.php
- app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/PostController.php

Explanation:
- The web route Route::resource('posts', PostController::class)->only('show') in routes/web.php is implemented by the PostController in app/Http/Controllers/PostController.php. Its show method accepts a Post model, computes comments_count and likes_count, and returns the posts.show Blade view with the post data.
- There is also an API variant of PostController at app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/PostController.php that implements a show method returning a PostResource for API responses. This is a separate controller (namespaced under Api\V1) and is not used by the web route, but it shares the same resource name and provides an API implementation of show.
- The admin PostController (app/Http/Controllers/Admin/PostController.php) does not implement a show method; it provides index, edit, create, store, update, and destroy methods for admin-related resources, not the web route in question.
